item.title: 股市中最热门的东西突然变成了无聊的技术
item.description: 多年来，人工智能这一高科技的未来一直被寄予厚望，而股市最新的热点则是科技行业中的一个老式领域。【原文：After years of soaring on hopes for a high-tech artificial-intelligence future, the stock market’s latest hot corner is an old fashioned part of the technology industry.】

item.title: 加拿大卡尼正式承认巴勒斯坦，实现历史性转变
item.description: 加拿大已正式承认巴勒斯坦国，与欧洲盟国结盟，推进一项招致美国总统唐纳德-特朗普批评的政策。【原文：Canada has formally recognized a Palestinian state, aligning itself with European allies and pushing ahead with a policy that has drawn criticism from US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 莫迪称税制改革将加快印度经济增长，并敦促本地采购
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）表示，下周一生效的消费税削减措施将促进家庭收入和企业发展，推动国家经济增长。【原文：India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the reduction in consumption taxes, that comes into effect Monday, will bolster household incomes and businesses, spurring the nation’s economic growth.】

item.title: 上涨 15%后，交易员认为美联储减息将推动新兴市场债券反弹
item.description: 资金经理和策略师们都在打赌，美联储重新转向削减利率将为新兴市场债券多年来最大的涨势火上浇油。【原文：Money managers and strategists are betting that the Federal Reserve’s shift back to cutting interest rates will pour fuel on the biggest emerging-market bond rally in years.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员锁定 12 月，看能否实现 2% 的通胀目标
item.description: 欧洲中央银行的官员们正在焦急地等待将于 12 月发布的下一版经济预测报告，该报告将帮助他们决定利率是否足够低，以持续实现 2% 的通胀率。【原文：European Central Bank officials are anxiously awaiting the next edition of their economic forecasts — due in December — that will help them decide whether interest rates are low enough to sustainably deliver inflation of 2%.】

item.title: 新兴市场大事记：美联储减息为新兴市场反弹增添动力（播客）
item.description: 维尼修斯-安德拉德（Vinicius Andrade）和宋子嘉在纽约讨论了美联储 2025 年的首次降息如何给今年大部分时间已经反弹的本币债券带来额外提振。【原文：Vinicius Andrade and Zijia Song in New York discuss how the Federal Reserve’s first rate cut of 2025 is giving an extra boost to local-currency bonds, which have already rallied for most of the year.】

item.title: 苹果 iPhone 17 展示了设备的持久力— 至少目前如此
item.description: 经过多年的适度升级，苹果公司终于推出了一款出色的新 iPhone。以下是我的第一印象。还有Meta 推出改变游戏规则的显示眼镜，触摸屏 Mac 接近现实。【原文：After years of modest upgrades, Apple finally has a standout new iPhone on its hands. Here are my first impressions. Also: Meta launches game-changing display glasses while touch screen Macs get closer to reality.】

item.title: 刚果将于 10 月结束钴出口禁令并实行配额制
item.description: 刚果民主共和国将允许从下月起恢复部分钴出口，因为这个世界上最大的金属生产国表示，配额将取代长达数月的运输禁令。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo will allow some cobalt exports to resume from next month, as the world’s biggest producer of the metal said quotas would replace a months-long ban on shipments.】

item.title: 卡扎克称，欧洲央行不应在物价处于目标水平时匆忙采取下一步行动
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克认为，欧洲央行可以容忍略低于 2% 的通胀率，并应花时间仔细权衡是否需要采取更多行动。【原文：The European Central Bank can tolerate inflation just below 2% and should take time to weigh carefully whether more action is needed, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 印度总统戈亚尔将访问美国，争取达成 "互利 "协议
item.description: 印度商业和工业部长皮尤什-戈亚尔（Piyush Goyal）将于下周一访问美国，以期达成一项 "互惠 "贸易协议，这表明因关税和新德里购买俄罗斯石油而产生的紧张局势有所缓和。【原文：India’s Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will visit the US on Monday with the view of getting a “mutually beneficial” trade deal, in a sign of easing tensions over tariffs and New Delhi’s purchases of Russian oil.】

item.title: 系统遭网络攻击后，欧洲航空旅行继续受阻
item.description: 周日，柏林、伦敦和布鲁塞尔的机场继续面临延误，因为一个重要的航空公司值机系统遭到网络攻击，迫使工作人员手动处理旅客登机手续。【原文：Airports in Berlin, London and Brussels faced continued delays on Sunday after a cyberattack on a key airline check-in system forced staff to process passengers manually.】

item.title: Optus 首席执行官承诺在紧急呼叫失败后进行改革
item.description: 澳大利亚 Optus 电话公司首席执行官斯蒂芬-鲁伊（Stephen Rue）表示，在一次导致至少两人死亡的紧急电话中断事件后，该公司将落实独立审查提出的任何建议。【原文：Australian phone company Optus will implement any recommendations from an independent review, Chief Executive Officer Stephen Rue said, after an emergency call outage that resulted in at least two deaths.】

item.title: 新世界公司创始人郑志刚创办数字资产公司 ALMAD
item.description: 新世界发展有限公司前首席执行官 Adrian Cheng 宣布了他的下一步行动：押注数字资产。【原文：Adrian Cheng, former chief executive officer of New World Development Co., has announced his next move: a bet on digital assets.】

item.title: 妇女对经济失去信心，远离劳动力市场
item.description: 妇女们正在失去对英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）能够扭转她们命运的信心，这一问题威胁着工党政府及其提振经济的雄心。【原文：Women are losing faith that UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer can turn their fortunes around, a problem that threatens both the Labour government and its ambitions to boost the economy.】

item.title: Arc'teryx 在西藏燃放烟花引发反弹，政府展开调查
item.description: 户外装备制造商 Arc'teryx 在西藏赞助的一场焰火表演在社交媒体上引起了反响，因为人们担心焰火表演会对环境造成影响，中国当局对此展开了调查。【原文：Chinese authorities launched an investigation after a fireworks show in Tibet sponsored by the outdoor gear maker Arc’teryx sparked a backlash on social media because of concern about the effect on the environment.】

item.title: 新加坡与埃及探讨自由贸易协定，促进两国关系
item.description: 新加坡和埃及同意探讨自由贸易协定的可行性，并计划加强经济合作。【原文：Singapore and Egypt agreed to explore the feasibility of a free trade agreement and plan to step up economic cooperation.】

item.title: 菲律宾吕宋岛北部为可能的超强台风做好准备
item.description: 菲律宾气象局说，台风拉加萨可能在周日接近菲律宾吕宋岛北部时发展成超强台风，威胁到水稻和玉米作物。【原文：Typhoon Ragasa may develop into a super typhoon on Sunday as it approaches the northern part of the main Luzon island in the Philippines, the weather bureau said, threatening rice and corn crops.】

item.title: 中国储蓄者拥有 23 万亿美元，除股票外几乎没有其他选择
item.description: 中国家庭正蹑手蹑脚地重回股票市场，部分原因是一个严峻的现实：几乎没有其他东西值得购买。【原文：Chinese households are tiptoeing back into equities, driven in part by a stark reality: Almost nothing else looks worth buying.】

item.title: 焦点转向就业市场，美国关键通胀指标将放缓
item.description: 美联储首选的基本通胀指标上个月可能增速放缓，这为政策制定者解决美国劳动力市场疲软问题提供了一些喘息空间。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s preferred gauge of underlying inflation likely grew at a slower pace last month, offering policymakers some breathing room to address weakness in the US labor market.】

item.title: 发行商跟不上步伐，投资者转向衍生品购买美国企业债券
item.description: 美国企业债券的投资者从利息支出中赚取了大量资金，并迅速进行再投资，以至于公司无法满足需求。【原文：Investors in US corporate bonds are earning so much money from their interest payments and reinvesting it so quickly that companies can’t keep up with the demand.】

item.title: 阿尔诺称财富税倡导者试图破坏经济
item.description: 贝尔纳-阿尔诺（Bernard Arnault）卷入了一场正在进行的关于如何恢复法国财政的争论，他称一位主张征收财富税的经济学家是极左分子，其意识形态将破坏法国的经济。【原文：Bernard Arnault has waded into an ongoing debate on how to restore France’s finances, calling an economist who has advocated a wealth tax a far-left activist whose ideology will destroy the country’s economy.】

item.title: 科技公司警告 H-1B 签证持有者避免出国旅行
item.description: 微软公司、Alphabet 公司、亚马逊公司和其他科技公司警告持有 H-1B 签证的员工周六返回美国，并避免海外旅行，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统对这一广泛使用的项目征收了 10 万美元的申请费。【原文：Microsoft Corp., Alphabet Inc., Amazon.com Inc. and other tech companies warned employees with H-1B visas to return to the US on Saturday and refrain from overseas travel after President Donald Trump slapped a $100,000 application fee on the widely used program.】

item.title: 美国统计局无故推迟公布 2024 年消费者支出数据
item.description: 美国劳工统计局（Bureau of Labor Statistics）推迟发布关于消费者支出的年度报告，这加剧了在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统解雇该局局长后对该局运作的质疑。【原文：The Bureau of Labor Statistics postponed a release of an annual report on consumer expenditures, adding to questions about the agency’s operations following President Donald Trump’s firing of its chief.】

item.title: 舒默和杰弗里斯要求特朗普在关门迫在眉睫之前举行会议
item.description: 在参议院共和党人和民主党人阻止了对立的权宜之计之后，民主党国会领导人周六要求在政府可能关门之前与唐纳德-特朗普总统会面。【原文：Democratic congressional leaders demanded on Saturday a meeting with President Donald Trump ahead of a possible government shutdown after Senate Republicans and Democrats blocked rival stopgap measures.】

item.title: 合作协议让一些债权人占尽先机
item.description:
协议旨在平息集团内贷款人之间的僵局，但其中一项条款可能会导致与指导委员会挂钩的纸张出现溢价

。【原文：

The agreements are meant to quell standoffs between lenders in a group, but one clause could create a premium for paper tied to steering committees

】

item.title: 乌克兰资金需求增加，欧盟推进俄罗斯资产计划
item.description: 欧盟正在制定一项计划，利用俄罗斯无法动用的中央银行资产向乌克兰提供贷款，这项计划正在取得进展；随着三年半战争的持续，欧盟正在努力满足基辅日益增长的资金需求。【原文：The European Union is making progress on a plan to provide loans to Ukraine using Russia’s immobilized central-bank assets — part of efforts to meet Kyiv’s rising financial needs as the 3 1/2-year war grinds on.】

item.title: 试管婴儿中断，Kindbody 的故事：胚胎混淆
item.description:
事实证明，2021年对《Kindbody》来说是艰难的一年，一些家庭开始质疑他们所了解的关于这家初创公司最先进的护理服务的一切。【原文：

2021 would prove to be a difficult year for Kindbody, leaving some families questioning everything they'd been told about the startup’s state-of-the-art care.

】

item.title: 斯托纳拉斯：欧洲央行处于 "良好平衡"，无需进一步放宽政策
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员亚尼斯-斯托纳拉斯（Yannis Stournaras）表示，欧洲央行可能已经完成了降低借贷成本的工作，任何进一步的宽松政策都需要对价格和经济增长前景做出有意义的改变。【原文：The European Central Bank is probably done lowering borrowing costs, with any further easing needing meaningful changes to the outlook for prices and economic growth, Governing Council member Yannis Stournaras said.】

item.title: 金德芭的故事E2，胚胎混淆（播客）
item.description: Dina 和 B 来到《金德博得》进行他们梦想多年的胚胎移植。但医生传来的消息却让他们怀疑来到《金体》是否是个错误。在《试管婴儿中断，金德芭迪的故事》第二集中，彭博社记者杰基-达瓦洛斯调查了出错的原因，并发现这次错误并非孤立事件。【原文：Dina and B arrive at Kindbody for the embryo transfer they’ve dreamed about for years. But their doctor delivers news that will make them question whether coming to Kindbody was a mistake. In Episode 2 of IVF Disrupted, The Kindbody Story, Bloomberg reporter Jackie Davalos investigates what went wrong and discovers that this error wasn’t an isolated incident.】

item.title: 经济反弹褪去，股市涨势有可能失去动力
item.description: 今年以来，尽管全球贸易战、挥之不去的财政担忧以及 9 月份的黯淡声誉，美国股市仍在不断攀升，创下历史新高。但对于担心美股涨势能否持久的投资者来说，经济可能发出了警告：美股涨势即将消退。【原文：US stocks have defied skeptics this year as they climbed to records despite a global trade war, lingering fiscal fears and September’s gloomy reputation. But for investors fretting about the rally’s durability, the economy may be sending a warning that the momentum is about to fade.】
